rules.description: Urgent diagnosis mapping by specialty from mapping_rules.json sample.

data.CARDIOLOGY:
Anything that cardiac specialist refer as urgent.
Heart murmur: Newborn-4 weeks old.
Feeding difficulties/FTT: Newborn-under 6 months of age.
o Weight gain concerns: Newborn-under 6 months of age.
Breathing concerns: Newborn-under 6months of age.
Hydrops.
data.ENDOCRINOLOGY:
Diabetes diagnosis.
Glucose >200.
Fasting glucose >126.
A1C >6.5
data.EAR_NOSE_AND_THROAT_OTOLARYNGOLOGY:
Nasal Fracture.
Severe Sleep Apnea.
Tongue Tie (Ankyloglossia) - 12 weeks & younger.
Parotitis with inflammation.
data.GYNECOLOGY:
Early Puberty or precocious puberty.
Delayed Puberty.
Ambiguous genitalia.
Ovarian mass suspicious of cancer.
data.NEUROLOGY:
Clinic question regarding seizure.
Spasms.
Abnormal MRI/EEG/CT.
Infantile spasms.
Abnormal jerking, involuntary movements.
Sandifer Syndrome.
Excessive startle.
New onset seizure or seizure like events (excluding spacing out/staring spells).
Any child < 2yrs old with seizures (this does not include febrile seizures).
Papilledema
2 or more ED visits for neuro diagnosis within the last 2 weeks.
Brachial Plexus Injury.
Spinal Muscular Atrophy.
Duchenne muscular dystrophy (if the patient is a male between ages 3-5 years).
Elevated Creatine Kinase (ck).
data.NUTRITION:
Failure to thrive (any age).
Under 12 months (any diagnosis).
data.OPHTHALMOLOGY:
Cataract in kids.
Corneal Abrasion.
ROP (retinopathy of prematurity).
White pupil.
data.ORTHOPEDICS:
Any Fracture
Clubfoot - less than 1yr.
Hip dysplasia or pain - Less than 15yrs.
Diagnosis of hip dysplasia with notes indicating SPICA (orthopedic cast hip or body cast), must have surgery report and images
SCFE (Slipped Capital Femoral Epiphysis).
data.PHYSICAL_THERAPY:
Torticollis.
Brachial Plexus.
NICU.
NAS (neonatal abstinence syndrome).
Referrals from NNFU clinic.
Infants 12mo and younger.
Chronic pain or pain syndrome.
Acute Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Hemophilia.
Spinal Muscular Atrophy.
Plagiocephaly - If over 10 months, send for clinical review.
Post-surgery.
Post Inpatient stay.
Oncology patients.
Sports injury or orthopedic diagnosis (ex: knee pain, neck pain, back pain).
Concussion.
Vestibular issues.

prompts.content: You are an LLM-powered urgent diagnosis triage assistant for Acme Children's Hospital. Classify urgency as one of: immediate_emergency, urgent, non_urgent. Use the client-specific specialty rules where applicable. Provide a concise rationale and clear recommendations. This is not medical advice; include a safety disclaimer.

tools.name: validate_insurance
tools.description: Validates patient insurance coverage and eligibility

tools.name: check_patient_history
tools.description: Retrieves patient medical history and previous visits

data.CARDIOLOGY: Chest pain with red flags (exertional, radiating, syncope), palpitations with HR >180, cyanosis in neonate, syncope with exertion.
data.NEUROLOGY: New focal neurologic deficit, first seizure in child <2y (non-febrile), recurrent seizures within 24h, severe headache with neck stiffness.
data.ENDOCRINOLOGY: Suspected DKA: blood glucose >250 with polyuria/polydipsia, vomiting, or Kussmaul respirations.
data.OPHTHALMOLOGY: Acute vision loss, white pupil (leukocoria), chemical eye exposure.
data.ORTHOPEDICS: Open fracture, neurovascular compromise, suspected SCFE, severe deformity post-injury.
data.EAR_NOSE_AND_THROAT_OTOLARYNGOLOGY: Epistaxis uncontrolled >30 minutes, suspected peritonsillar abscess, nasal fracture with deformity.
data.INFECTIOUS_DISEASE: Fever with neck stiffness or petechial rash, suspected sepsis.
data.GASTROENTEROLOGY: GI bleed (hematemesis/melena), severe dehydration from vomiting/diarrhea.
data.PULMONOLOGY_RESPIRATORY_AND_SLEEP_MEDICI: Asthma exacerbation not responsive to rescue inhaler, resting SpO2 <92%.
data.WOUND_CARE: Deep laceration with gaping edges or uncontrolled bleeding.

prompts.content: You are an LLM-powered urgent diagnosis triage assistant for NorthStar Health Network. Always bias toward safety when red flags are present. Classify urgency and provide rationale and next-step recommendations. Include a non-medical-advice disclaimer.

data.GENERAL_SURGERY: Suspected appendicitis (RLQ pain with fever/vomiting), incarcerated hernia, postoperative complications with fever.
data.NEUROLOGY: Head injury with red flags (LOC, vomiting, severe headache), new focal deficit, papilledema.
data.OPHTHALMOLOGY: Corneal abrasion with severe pain, chemical burn, white pupil.
data.ORTHOPEDICS: Any fracture with deformity, suspected septic joint, SCFE.
data.ENDOCRINOLOGY: Symptomatic hypoglycemia not resolving with oral intake, hyperglycemia >300 with ketone odor.
data.HEMATOLOGY_ANDONCOLOGY: Hemoglobin <8 or rapidly dropping, easy bruising with petechiae (consider urgent evaluation).
data.EAR_NOSE_AND_THROAT_OTOLARYNGOLOGY: Foreign body aspiration suspected, airway compromise, severe sleep apnea.
data.PHYSICAL_THERAPY: Post-op immediate needs or acute neurologic change — route for clinical review (not standard PT scheduling).
data.INFECTIOUS_DISEASE: Febrile child with lethargy, neck stiffness, or rash suggestive of meningococcemia.
data.WOUND_CARE: All deep or contaminated wounds requiring closure or irrigation.

prompts.content: You are an LLM-powered urgent diagnosis triage assistant for CareWell Clinics. Use the provided specialty rules to guide urgency classification. Provide rationale and actionable next steps. Include a safety disclaimer.

config.note: Currently disabled for CareWell - manual verification process
